0.title: Auto, taxi drivers in Delhi to go on strike tomorrow demanding hike in fares
0.article_body: Various unions of auto, taxi and minibus drivers in Delhi will go on strike on Monday demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares. Sarvodaya Driver Association Delhi, whose members also drive for cab aggregators, said it'll go on an indefinite strike. The Delhi government has said it's setting up a committee to consider revising the fares.

1.title: Evergreen's 'Ever Forward' ship freed over a month after running aground in US
1.article_body: Evergreen Marine Corporation's giant container ship 'Ever Forward' has been freed more than a month after it ran aground in Chesapeake Bay, US. The ship's navigational status changed to "under way using engine" on Sunday from being classified as "aground" on March 13. Last year, Evergreen's 'Ever Given' ship got stuck in the Suez Canal, disrupting global shipping for months.

2.title: Like all parents, we feel very nervous: Madhavan as son wins silver in Danish Open
2.article_body: Actor R Madhavan tweeted, "We feel proud, overwhelmed, very grateful and like all parents, very nervous," after his 16-year-old son Vedaant Madhavan bagged the silver medal in the men's 1500m freestyle swimming event at Danish Open in Copenhagen. The actor was responding to filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's tweet, who congratulated Vedaant and asked R Madhavan, "How does it feel?"

3.title: Man buys ₹15.4 lakh registration number for ₹71,000 2-wheeler in Chandigarh
3.article_body: A man in Chandigarh has bought a registration number worth ₹15.44 lakh at an auction for his two-wheeler worth ₹71,000, Hindustan Times reported. The man said he intends to use the number ending 0001 for his newly-bought Activa and later for his car. Over 370 registration numbers had gone under the hammer in the recently-conducted auction by Chandigarh licensing authority.

4.title: Crime Branch of Delhi Police joins probe into Jahangirpuri violence
4.article_body: The violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession is being jointly probed by the Delhi Police Crime Branch and the district police, Special Commissioner of Police (Crime Branch) Ravindra Yadav said. A total of 20 people have been arrested in connection with the incident. Fourteen of them were produced before the Rohini court on Sunday.

5.title: Stuff of dreams: Harbhajan on Umran's maiden over with 3 wickets vs PBKS
5.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to praise Umran Malik after the SRH pacer delivered a maiden 20th over against PBKS in IPL 2022. He wrote, "This last over by Umran was surreal. A maiden with three wickets and a run-out. Stuff of dreams!...Blue jersey coming soon." Parthiv Patel tweeted, "This is serious stuff from Umran. Pace and accuracy."

6.title: What happened after slap was disturbing: Jay Leno on Will slapping Chris
6.article_body: Speaking about actor Will Smith slapping comedian-actor Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, comedian Jay Leno said that the slap wasn't the most disturbing thing. "Because he was kind of smirking after he slapped Rock. It was the yelling of the obscenities. Then you go, 'Whoa. What's going on here? This is real anger'," Jay added.

7.title: You better know how loved you are: Aditi on Siddharth's b'day
7.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari, taking to Instagram, wished actor Siddharth on his birthday. She shared a picture with Siddharth and wrote, "Happy birthday my pixie boy...Always be magic, mad and full of laughter. Always be you...Thank you for the unending laughter and adventures!" The actress further wrote, "You better know how loved you are."

8.title: Leonardo said 'Go ahead': Amy on joke about his girlfriends at Oscars
8.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer has revealed actor Leonardo DiCaprio's reaction to her joke that she cracked while hosting the Oscars 2022. Amy had joked, "Leonardo's done so much to fight climate change and leave behind a cleaner, greener planet...for his girlfriends...Because he's older and they're younger." Talking about Leonardo's reaction, Amy said, "He said, 'Go ahead.' They didn't care."

9.title: 56 inches can't mask 56 lakh: Moitra on NYT COVID-19 deaths report
9.article_body: Criticising the Narendra Modi-led Central Government over COVID-19 deaths in India, TMC MP Mahua Moitra tweeted that "56 inches can't mask 56 lakhs". She added, "Lying and stalling data publication doesn't make truth go away." Her comments came after The New York Times report claimed WHO estimated India's death toll to be 40 lakh, nearly eight times the official figure.

10.title: Ukraine sought $50 bn in financial support from G7 nations: Official
10.article_body: Ukraine has sought $50 billion in financial support from G7 countries to help it cover a war-linked budget deficit over the next six months, a senior Ukrainian official said. The official also said that the government is considering issuing 0% coupon bonds to help it deal with the deficit. Notably, all the G7 nations have strongly opposed the Russian invasion.

11.title: Security stepped up post incidents of violence in Haridwar
11.article_body: Heavy security was deployed across Haridwar following the incident of violence and stone-pelting in the Bhagwanpur area of the city on Saturday. "Stones were pelted by unknown persons and the search operations have begun to arrest the miscreants. Yes, injuries have been reported but no police personnel was injured in the incident," Senior Superintendent of Police (Haridwar) Yogendra Singh Rawat.

12.title: We need him in India colours asap, he & Bumrah will terrify the Angrez: Tharoor on Umran
12.article_body: Referring to SRH pacer Umran Malik, who clocks 150-kmph mark regularly, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "We need him in India colours asap. What a phenomenal talent." He added, "Blood him before he burns out...Take him to England for the Test match greentop. He and Bumrah bowling in tandem will terrify the Angrez!" Umran took four wickets against PBKS today.

13.title: Facing Umran Malik in nets is a nightmare: SRH batter Glenn Phillips
13.article_body: SRH batter Glenn Phillips said facing his teammate Umran Malik in the nets is a nightmare for him. "I've got my chest guard on (during net sessions) to not get hurt. Imagine what those balls (in the game) will be feeling out there," Glenn added. The pacer has scalped nine wickets in six games in the IPL 2022 so far.

14.title: Shanghai outbreak stalls plans for 3rd aircraft carrier: Report
14.article_body: A COVID-19 lockdown in Shanghai may affect the launch of China's third aircraft carrier, according to a report. The Chinese navy was widely expected to launch the aircraft carrier around its 73rd anniversary on April 23. "But the plan faces delay as the rampant pandemic...has delayed the transport of some key components," a source quoted by the report said.

15.title: Ranbir's brother-in-law Bharat shares new pics from Ranbir-Alia's wedding
15.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's brother-in-law and entrepreneur Bharat Sahni, who is married to Ranbir's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni, took to Instagram on Sunday to share new pictures from Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding ceremonies. "Last few days have been straight out of a fairytale," Sahni wrote. He added, "Congratulations to the beautiful couple."

16.title: 195-shot rally takes place during women's doubles badminton match
16.article_body: South Korea's Baek Ha Na and Lee Yu Rim won a marathon battle against China's Du Yue and Li Wen Mei to enter the final of the 2022 Gwangju YONEX Korea Masters. While there were several rallies that went over 50 shots during the women's doubles badminton game, a "record-breaking" 195-shot rally also took place during the game.

17.title: Smuggled gold worth ₹1.58 crore seized in MP's Indore, 5 arrested
17.article_body: A Directorate of Revenue Intelligence unit seized 3 kg gold worth ₹1.58 crore after intercepting a car on the Mumbai-Agra highway near MP's Indore. Three smuggled gold bars were recovered from a specially built cavity in the car and all four occupants were arrested. A jeweller, who allegedly supplied the bars, was also arrested after the four revealed his location.

18.title: BJP gave money to woo voters during Kolhapur by-polls: Maha MoS
18.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home (Urban) Satej Patil said BJP ran a vicious campaign and distributed money to woo voters during the recently concluded Kolhapur North by-polls. Adding that BJP also gave free tickets of 'The Kashmir Files', Patil said, "Voters didn't succumb to such tactics as they voted for Maha Vikas Aghadi. This victory...belongs to people of Kolhapur."

19.title: 2 prime accused of Jahangirpuri violence sent to 1-day police custody
19.article_body: A Delhi court on Sunday sent two prime accused in the Jahangirpuri violence during a Hanuman Jayanti procession to police custody for one day. The key accused Ansar and Aslam will be produced before the court later, advocate Vikas Verma said. The remaining 12 accused in this case have been sent to judicial custody for 14 days, he added.

20.title: Man caught on camera firing gun during violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri
20.article_body: An unidentified man was caught on camera firing a gun during the violence that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti rally on Saturday. As per reports, Delhi Police is trying to ascertain his identity. So far, 20 people have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended over the incident and firearms and swords have been seized.

21.title: SRH become first team to win four matches in a row in IPL 2022, defeat PBKS
21.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) have become the first team to win four matches in a row in IPL 2022. SRH defeated PBKS by seven wickets to move to the fourth position on the points table. Aiden Markram and Nicholas Pooran registered an unbeaten 75-run partnership to help SRH chase down the 152-run target in 18.5 overs.

22.title: When I first saw Umran bowl, he reminded me of Waqar: Irfan Pathan
22.article_body: Recalling when he first saw Umran Malik bowl, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said that the 22-year-old reminded him of former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. Umran was noticed by Irfan when they were part of the Jammu and Kashmir team. Irfan was a player and mentor in the team. Later, Umran made his IPL debut in 2021 for SunRisers Hyderabad.

23.title: Drunk policeman slaps 2 blind men, breaks walking stick in Chennai
23.article_body: A drunk police constable in Chennai allegedly slapped two blind men and broke their walking stick after they asked him for directions. The constable was not in uniform and was wearing plain clothes when the alleged incident took place, reports said. The victims raised an alarm after which a case was registered against him by the Triplicane Police Station.

24.title: Wanted to improve quality of sleep: Richa on physical transformation
24.article_body: Richa Chadha, speaking about her physical transformation, has said, "I wanted to become healthier, overall. I wanted the quality of my sleep, movement, exercise and mobility to improve." She further stated, "Too much exercise can damage your insides and be counter-productive to your effort." Richa added that rest is "underrated" but very important for the body.

25.title: Rashid captaining GT vs CSK as Hardik misses out due to groin stiffness, playing XIs out
25.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) won the toss and elected to bowl first against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. GT are being led by Rashid Khan in the match as Hardik Pandya misses out due to stiffness in his groin. GT have included Alzarri Joseph and Wriddhiman Saha in their playing XI.

26.title: Sonu Sood pens note for his father on his birth anniversary
26.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood on Sunday took to Instagram to pen a note for his late father on his birth anniversary. The actor wrote, "Like I always used to say there is no life without you and this I realise every second of my life. Wish you were around to guide us...Be with us till I see you again."

27.title: I back my yorkers, bowl with 100% effort even in practice sessions: Avesh
27.article_body: Disclosing reason behind his successful yorkers during death overs in IPL 2022, LSG pacer Avesh Khan said he backs his yorkers in practice sessions and bowls with 100% effort even there. "If you miss the yorker, then...batter has a good chance to hit the ball for a boundary," he added. Avesh has taken 11 wickets from six matches so far.

28.title: 72-yr-old devotee from Chhattisgarh dies at Puri's Jagannath Temple
28.article_body: A 72-year-old devotee from Chhattisgarh died at the Jagannath Temple in Odisha's Puri moments after he paid obeisance at the shrine on Sunday morning. He had come to the temple along with his family at around 10 am. After darshan of deities, he sat on the stairs where he suddenly collapsed.

29.title: Stones pelted during Hanuman Jayanti rally in Haridwar, 114 booked
29.article_body: As many as 114 people were booked after stones were pelted during a rally on Hanuman Jayanti at a village in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Saturday. The incident was reported in Bhagwanpur area. Police said the situation was brought under control in a short time and Provincial Armed Constabulary along with state policemen have been deployed in and around the village.

30.title: Campus Activewear IPO expected to be launched in May: Reports
30.article_body: Campus Activewear's IPO is expected to be launched in May 2022, according to reports. The company plans to sell 5.1 crore shares that'll be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to shareholders and Campus won't receive any of the funds. It had received market regulator SEBI's nod for the IPO launch in March.

31.title: Ranbir Kapoor returns to work 2 days after wedding with Alia Bhatt
31.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor was spotted going into the T-Series office in Mumbai's Andheri on Sunday. The actor got married to actress Alia Bhatt on April 14 followed by a post-wedding party on Saturday. In a video shared by a journalist account, Ranbir can be seen giving a thumbs up to the media persons who congratulated him for the wedding.

32.title: Former AAP HP chief 'characterless', was about to be terminated: Sisodia
32.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Saturday called Aam Aadmi Party's Himachal Pradesh unit president Anup Kesari "characterless" and said that he was about to be terminated. He also criticised the BJP for inducting Kesari, who allegedly has complaints against him and talks ill of women. "That is his rightful place," Sisodia further said.

33.title: Shaheen Afridi is the number 1 bowler for me: Babar Azam
33.article_body: Praising pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his fellow countryman is the number one bowler for him. "The way he [Shaheen] works and performs, he has to go further ahead [in his career]," he added. Shaheen, who made his international debut in 2018, has taken 201 wickets in 94 international matches across formats so far.

34.title: Which Indian crypto exchanges recently disabled UPI and other payment options?
34.article_body: Indian crypto exchange CoinSwitch Kuber recently disabled all modes of payments for purchasing crypto on its platform. WazirX and CoinDCX announced that rupee deposits through MobiKwik have been temporarily suspended. While BuyUcoin Co-founder Atulya Bhatt said the platform has halted UPI payments, Mudrex CEO Edul Patel told Bloomberg that Indian payment gateways have started withdrawing support.

35.title: Kim Jong-un observes N Korea's missile test, gives 'important instructions'
35.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un observed the test-firing of a new type of tactical guided weapon, state news agency KCNA said. "It's of great significance in improving the firepower of the frontline long-range artillery units and enhancing the efficiency in the operation of tactical nukes," KCNA added. It also said that Kim "gave important instructions" on strengthening the defence capabilities.

36.title: Ukraine-returned students protest in Delhi, seek admission in India
36.article_body: Students who returned from Ukraine, along with their parents staged a protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar demanding admission to Indian institutions. "The government should save our children's careers the way they saved their lives and brought them back from Ukraine," said one of the parents. Over 20,000 Indian students returned to India after the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

37.title: 4 wickets fall in an over in IPL without any runs scored for 1st time ever
37.article_body: The SRH-PBKS match in IPL 2022 marked the first instance of four wickets falling in an over in IPL without any runs scored. SRH fast bowler Umran Malik took three wickets without conceding any run in PBKS' 20th over. SRH took another wicket on the last delivery through run-out. Umran recorded bowling figures of 4-1-28-4 in the match.

38.title: Dinesh Karthik has presented strong case for India comeback: Kohli
38.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli, talking about Dinesh Karthik's current form in IPL 2022, has said that the 36-year-old wicketkeeper has presented a strong case for India comeback. This comes after Karthik had said that he plans to be part of the Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Karthik has scored 197 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

39.title: Myanmar junta frees over 1,600 prisoners in annual tradition
39.article_body: Myanmar's military government on Sunday announced the release of 1,619 prisoners, including 42 foreigners, to mark the new year in the country. The prisoners were released "to bring joy for the people and address humanitarian concerns", a senior official said. Notably, political prisoners were not included among those pardoned in the annual tradition.

40.title: Important for MI to keep dressing room environment in good shape: Ojha
40.article_body: Following Mumbai Indians' six consecutive defeats in the ongoing IPL 2022, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said that the franchise should keep the dressing room environment healthy. "It is important is how you navigate the dressing room atmosphere. I'm saying this because MI have always kept it good," he added. Ojha had earlier won two IPL trophies with MI.

41.title: Will continue to respond strongly to wilful misconduct: Sequoia
41.article_body: Sequoia Capital on Sunday said it'll continue to respond strongly to wilful misconduct or fraud. "We will take tough calls where needed in the interest of doing what is right...We will continue to have zero tolerance towards proven wrongdoing," it added. Sequoia is the largest shareholder in fintech firm BharatPe and owns a stake in CoinSwitch and CredAvenue, among others.

42.title: Man fired for being angry over unwanted birthday party gets ₹3.4cr in damages in US
42.article_body: An American man has won $450,000 (₹3.4 crore) in damages after suing his former employers for allegedly firing him for being "angry" that his office threw him a surprise birthday party. Kevin Berling, who suffers from an anxiety disorder that gives him panic attacks, had told his bosses he didn't want a surprise birthday party but got one anyway.

43.title: Police uses drones to patrol Jamia Nagar, Jasola after Delhi violence
43.article_body: Delhi Police uses drone cameras for patrolling in Jamia Nagar and Jasola to ensure law and order in the areas a day after violence was reported during Hanuman Jayanti procession in North West Delhi's Jahangirpuri. On Saturday, stones were pelted following an argument during the rally. Heavy police force has been deployed in the area after the incident.

44.title: Interstate drug syndicate busted in Delhi, heroin worth ₹20 cr recovered
44.article_body: An interstate drug syndicate based in Manipur, West Bengal was busted in Delhi and the police recovered heroin worth ₹20 crore. The syndicate was indulged in the supply of drugs in the Northeast, West Bengal, Bihar, UP and Delhi NCR, said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Special Cell) Rajiv Ranjan.

45.title: Instagram influencer trolls Katrina's cooking skills, she replies
45.article_body: Days after actress Katrina Kaif posted a picture of breakfast she prepared for her husband Vicky Kaushal, Instagram influencer Freddy Birdy took to Instagram Stories to troll her. He posted a series of 'easy recipes' for her to create including chilly cheese toast, boiled eggs and mango pickle. Katrina replied to one of the stories, writing, "This is not easy."

46.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor will not go for a honeymoon: Report
46.article_body: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor will not be going for a honeymoon following their wedding which was held on Thursday, reported Midday. It stated Alia will resume shooting for Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' while Ranbir will begin the first schedule of Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Animal' in Manali. Earlier reports suggested they will honeymoon in South Africa.

47.title: Was surprised with Kuldeep's cricketing knowledge in first meeting: Akhtar
47.article_body: Recalling his first meeting with Kuldeep Yadav, Shoaib Akhtar said he was surprised with the Indian spinner's cricketing knowledge. "He answered...spoke about everything correctly...In fact, I asked him a lot about the legalities and nitty-gritties of cricket and he answered all of them correctly," he added. "I felt weird because he just played five-ten matches for India," he further said.

48.title: MI's Rohit has failed to use India captaincy to up his game: Vaughan
48.article_body: Ex-England skipper Michael Vaughan has opined that Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma has "failed" to use his confidence from India captaincy to help "his game to go really up into the sky." This comes after Rohit's Mumbai suffered six consecutive defeats in the ongoing IPL 2022. Rohit has scored 114 runs in six games so far, averaging 19.

49.title: 2 men held for opening fire at Pataudi civic panel chief's house
49.article_body: Two men were arrested on Saturday for allegedly opening fire on the house of Pataudi Municipal Committee Chairman Chander Bhan Sehgal. The police said that they had recovered an illegal pistol, two magazines and three cartridges from their possession. Notably, Sehgal had earlier claimed that he was threatened by a gangster, who sought a share in his liquor business.

50.title: Woman takes front seat to let Uber driver offer namaz in the back seat; pic viral
50.article_body:
A Mumbai woman's post about taking the front seat to let her Uber driver offer namaz in the back seat during Ramadan has gone viral. 
"Azaan started playing on the driver's mobile...I asked him, 'Do you want to pay namaz?' and he asked, 'Can I?',” wrote Priya Singh. She added, "We parked the car on the roadside for his prayers."

51.title: Mumbai techie cheated of ₹5.06 lakh while paying electricity bill
51.article_body:
A software developer in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹5.06 lakh by a cyber fraudster who posed as an e-wallet firm's customer care executive. The man was trying to pay electricity bill, but the bill on the e-wallet app was much more so he searched for a helpline number. 
The fraud took place when he called on that number.

52.title: Was saving people when I was hit with stones: Officer on Delhi violence
52.article_body: Assistant Sub-Inspector of Police (Delhi) Arun Kumar, while narrating the sequence of events of Jahangirpuri violence, said that he was trying to save people when he was being hit with stones. "People started running, leaving their vehicles behind. I was trying to remove everyone from the violence-hit area," he added. Police have arrested 14 people in connection with the violence.

53.title: Non-BJP CMs likely to meet to discuss political situation: Raut
53.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday said a conference of non-BJP Chief Ministers is likely to be held in Mumbai to discuss the prevailing political situation in India. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee had earlier written to non-BJP CMs on the same matter. Issues including unemployment, inflation and attempts to create communal discord will be discussed, Raut added.

54.title: Hindu outfit demands arrest of BJP's Eshwarappa
54.article_body: A Hindu outfit named the Akhila Bharath Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) has demanded the arrest of former Karnataka Minister and BJP leader KS Eshwarappa. "The BJP is using Hindus for the sake of power but is not protecting them. The government should have sacked Eshwarappa, instead he submitted his resignation owing to pressure," said ABHM state President Rajesh Pavithran.

55.title: Ex-Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora joins TMC after quitting Congress
55.article_body: Former Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora on Sunday quit the party and joined TMC in presence of MP Abhishek Banerjee. While tendering his resignation, Bora said, "Instead of fighting against BJP, a section of senior...leaders of Assam Congress have been maintaining secret understanding with BJP government especially the CM." He added, "I shall continue my fight more vigorously against BJP."

56.title: MI is a team of comebacks, expect them to finish strong: Malinga
56.article_body: After Mumbai Indians registered its sixth straight loss in the IPL 2022 on Saturday, former MI pacer Lasith Malinga has said that the franchise has "always been a team of comebacks". "Whether or not they get through to the playoffs...expect them to have a strong finish to the season," said Malinga, who is now the fast-bowling coach of Rajasthan Royals.

57.title: Olivia Thirlby joins Downey Jr, Cillian Murphy in Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'
57.article_body: Olivia Thirlby, known for films like 'Juno' and 'Dredd', has joined the cast of Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'. Olivia will be seen sharing screen space with Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt and Rami Malek in the upcoming project. It's based on the life of American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer and his role in the development of the atomic bomb.

58.title: BJP mentally divided India, worst is yet to come: Cong spokesperson
58.article_body: Congress Chief Spokesperson Atul Londhe said BJP has already "mentally divided" India and Hindus will be further segregated as "upper castes-lower castes". Centre's plans to impose Hindi has also sowed a north-south division, Londhe added. Speaking on the claims that BJP is using central agencies to retain power, Londhe said, "No [Maharashtra government] leaders get any kind of relief."

59.title: ₹10.5 cr wastewater treatment facility inaugurated at Byculla Zoo
59.article_body: A wastewater treatment facility was inaugurated at Mumbai's Byculla Zoo by Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday. The ₹10.5 crore facility, constructed by BMC, has the capacity to treat 5 lakh litres of water. It will be used by the zoo to reuse its wastewater for watering its garden and also for cleaning and drinking purposes.

60.title: Video shows swords raised amid Hanuman Jayanti rally in Delhi's Jahangirpuri
60.article_body: Amid a probe into the Jahangirpuri violence, a video has shown people brandishing swords, pistols and shotguns amid the Hanuman Jayanti rally. The video was reportedly taken while the rally was in C-D Block Market in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where several people were injured following stone-pelting.  Police had earlier confirmed the presence of illegal weapons during the rally.

61.title: Warner-Shaw complement each other well, their combination helps DC: Rajput
61.article_body: After the Delhi Capitals' opening batting pair of David Warner and Prithvi Shaw posted a 50-run partnership against the RCB, former India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has said that the pair "really complement each other well". "The right-left hand combination helps (DC)...Shaw is an explosive player...it’s very difficult to stop him...Warner takes his time and is much more mature," Rajput said.

62.title: Court cannot act as expert in field of education: SC
62.article_body: A court cannot act as an expert in the field of education and it should be left to the institutions to determine whether a candidate possesses the necessary qualifications, the Supreme Court has said. A bench of Justices MR Shah and BV Nagarathna said there can't be any deviation from the educational qualifications mentioned in an advertisement for a job.

63.title: Gang of 4 rob driver, run away with his taxi in Bengaluru; arrested
63.article_body: Four people have been arrested for robbing a taxi driver in Sampigehalli area of Bengaluru on Saturday, police said. The accused persons also ran away with the car and a gold chain. They had booked the taxi at Shivaram Karanth Layout and snatched the car keys when the driver reached the pickup spot.

64.title: Hardik shares pics with MS Dhoni ahead of their IPL 2022 clash, calls him 'My main man'
64.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to share pictures of himself with former CSK captain MS Dhoni. The duo met each other ahead of their IPL 2022 clash, which will take place tonight. "My main man," Hardik captioned the post. GT are currently on the top of the points table, while CSK are ninth.

65.title: It's been a joy ride: Jaideep Ahlawat as he wraps 'An Action Hero' shoot
65.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat has completed shooting for his upcoming film 'An Action Hero', which also stars Ayushmann Khurrana. In a statement, Jaideep said that working on 'An Action Hero' has been a joy ride and a learning experience. It is directed by Anirudh Iyer, who previously served as an assistant director on 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' and 'Zero'.

66.title: Kuldeep wasn't able to get many opportunities at KKR: Ponting
66.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting has said that DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav was "unable to get" opportunities at Kolkata Knight Riders. "Kuldeep is really thriving in the environment that we...(have created) around him. Obviously at KKR...with the quality of spinners they had...he was unable to get the opportunity that he should have got," Ponting said.

67.title: Which batters have smashed 6 boundaries in an over in IPL history?
67.article_body: As many as 11 batters have smashed six boundaries in an over in IPL history. Chris Gayle and Suresh Raina have hit seven boundaries in an over, while Jos Buttler has smashed six boundaries in an over twice. Pat Cummins and Dinesh Karthik are the two cricketers to have hit six boundaries in an over in IPL 2022.

68.title: Wasim Jaffer names his underrated XI of all time, includes Shikhar Dhawan
68.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has named his underrated XI of all time. He named ex-Australia captain Mark Taylor as the skipper of the side, which features Tillakaratne Dilshan as wicketkeeper. Jaffer also included Shikhar Dhawan in the side. Remaining players are Younis Khan, Shivnarine Chanderpaul, Michael Hussey, Paul Collingwood, Abdul Razzaq, Rangana Herath, Chaminda Vaas and Ryan Harris.

69.title: ₹5,500 got over in 10 days, survived due to shoot for ₹2000-3000 per day: Sonu
69.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood recalled that he came to Mumbai with ₹5,500, using which, he thought he would survive a month. He said that the money got over in 10 days and that he thought he would have to ask for money from home. "I got a shoot for ₹2000-3000 per day so I could survive that journey," he added.

70.title: Will try and comeback again: Rohit after MI's 6th straight loss
70.article_body: After losing their 6th consecutive IPL match on Saturday, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit has said that their side "will try and comeback". "I take full responsibility. It's not the end of the world, we have come back before and we will try and comeback again," Sharma said. He added that KL Rahul, who scored a century, batted "brilliantly" against them.

71.title: We weren't good enough, table isn't lying: Bumrah on MI being in last spot
71.article_body: Following MI's sixth straight loss in IPL 2022, pacer Jasprit Bumrah said his side were not good enough in the past matches and points table isn't lying. "With a lot of games and a little luck here and there, but yeah, it's the way it is. I'm not shying away from that," he added. MI are currently last in standings.

72.title: Pocket watch stolen by Nazi soldier during World War II found; pic surfaces
72.article_body: A pocket watch that was reportedly stolen by a Nazi soldier during World War II has been found in Belgium after 80 years. The watch was crafted in 1910 by Alfred Overstrijd, a Jewish man in Netherlands, for his brother Louis, who was arrested by the Nazis in 1942. The watch was returned to Alfred's grandchildren and it still works.

73.title: Twitter's edit feature may retain copy of original tweet
73.article_body: Twitter's edit button feature may preserve the previous versions of a tweet. According to security researcher Jane Manchun Wong, Twitter's approach to the edit button is "immutable” as it will preserve a copy of the original tweet, along with a list of prior conversations and tag the new tweet as "amended content". However, Twitter is yet to confirm this.

74.title: Zomato defers new food quality policy after criticism by restaurants: Report
74.article_body: Zomato has deferred the implementation of its new food quality policy to May 3 from April 18 after criticism by restaurants, reports said. Under the policy called 'Severe Food Quality' rules, Zomato proposed it would temporarily ban restaurants if consumers complained about their food quality. Zomato has deferred the policy and sought feedback from restaurant partners on the new policy.

75.title: Just 1 or 2 days in office ideal for hybrid work: Harvard Business School study
75.article_body: Just one or two days in the office is the ideal setup for hybrid work, according to a paper from Harvard Business School. "Intermediate hybrid work is plausibly the sweet spot...where workers enjoy flexibility and yet aren't as isolated compared to peers who are predominantly working from home," it said. "Hybrid work is associated with improved worker outcomes," it added.

76.title: CM Kejriwal is an irresponsible leader: Delhi Congress chief
76.article_body: Delhi Congress President Anil Chaudhary has called CM Arvind Kejriwal an "irresponsible leader" after violence took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday. "Kejriwal is just playing the blame game. This is a statement from an irresponsible leader. When Congress was in power, Shiela (Dixit) ji stood for the people and maintained peace and harmony," Chaudhary said.

77.title: FPIs turn net sellers again, withdraw ₹4,500 cr between Apr 8-15
77.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net sellers again after withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 8-15. FPIs had been net sellers for six months between October 2021 and March 2022 and had turned net buyers between April 1-8 with an investment of ₹7,707 crore. Apart from equities, FPIs withdrew net ₹415 crore from the debt markets last week.

78.title: Muralitharan picked up 800th Test wicket on his career's last ball
78.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, the only player in Test cricket history to take 800 wickets, picked up his 800th wicket on the final ball of his Test career. Muralitharan, who turns 50 today, dismissed India's Pragyan Ojha as his 800th Test wicket in July 2010. Muralitharan is the fastest to pick 400, 500, 600, 700 and 800 Test wickets.

79.title: 5 killed, 5 injured as vehicle overturns in Assam; PM expresses condolences
79.article_body: At least five persons, who were returning home from a Bihu function, were killed and five others sustained injuries when a vehicle carrying them overturned in Assam's Biswanath. "Prima facie, over-speeding seems to be the cause of the accident," a police officer said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and CM Himanta Biswa Sarma expressed their condolences over the loss of lives.

80.title: Fan blocks Shilpa's car door taking selfie, she says 'What are you doing?'
80.article_body: A video shared by a journalist account is going viral on social media showing a fan blocking actress Shilpa Shetty's car door while trying to take a selfie. Shilpa was getting into her car with her daughter Samisha in Mumbai's Juhu when the incident occurred. She can be heard saying, "Arrey bhai, kya kar rahe ho (What are you doing)?"

81.title: Ranveer stands on table, raps 'Apna Time Aayega' at Delhi wedding
81.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh attended a wedding in Delhi and stood on a table while rapping his song 'Apna Time Aayega' from 2019 film 'Gully Boy'. In another video, Ranveer wore a red coat while rapping as wedding guests danced around him. The pictures and videos were shared on Instagram Stories by fashion designer and influencer Tarini Manchanda.

82.title: Connivance between SDPI and CPI(M): Kerala BJP Vice President
82.article_body: The Vice President of BJP's Kerala unit, KS Radhakrishnan, has alleged that there is some "sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)". "The state government acts like the policemen in old Hindi films. There is a sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)," Radhakrishnan said by referring to the alleged murder of an RSS worker on Saturday.

83.title: Pune liquor shop manager killed for refusing to give free alcohol
83.article_body: A 40-year-old liquor shop manager was allegedly murdered in Pune's Vadgaon Budruk after he refused to entertain a demand for free alcohol and money. The 27-year-old accused had reportedly strangulated the manager in a fit of rage after being refused. He was arrested by police the same day and has been booked under relevant sections of the IPC.

84.title: Inform if suspicious activities happen: Police after Jahangirpuri violence
84.article_body: After the violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, police have requested people to inform them if any suspicious activities take place in their area or if any group indulges in arguments. “We’ve arrested 14 people, seven cases were filed & weapons were recovered," Dependra Pathak, Delhi’s Special Commissioner of Police, Law & Order, said.

85.title: Pak says its forces facing cross-border attacks from Afghanistan
85.article_body: Pakistan has said there has been a significant increase in cross-border attacks from Afghanistan and that its security forces are being targeted. It added that despite asking the Afghan authorities repeatedly to act against the militants, the attacks continued to take place "with impunity". Meanwhile, Pakistan reportedly conducted air strikes in Afghanistan on Friday, killing  about 40 people.

86.title: Who was 'Mother of Pak' Bilquis Edhi whose death was condoled by PM Modi?
86.article_body: Bilquis Bano Edhi who recently died aged 74 in Pakistan's Karachi was one of the most active philanthropists in the country. Born in Gujarat, Edhi (also known as 'Mother of Pakistan') started a charity that saved over 16,000 unwanted babies in Pakistan. Her foundation had also adopted the specially-abled Indian girl Geeta who wandered into Pakistan when she was 10.

87.title: Govt amends FEMA rules to allow up to 20% FDI in IPO-bound LIC
87.article_body: The government has amended the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) to allow up to 20% foreign direct investment (FDI) in state-run LIC through the automatic route. "Foreign investment in LIC shall be subject to the provisions of...Life Insurance Corporation Act, 1956," a gazette notification said. The development comes ahead of LIC's IPO, expected to be India's biggest-ever public issue.

88.title: We started this as small Kannada project, only Yash had vision: Director on KGF
88.article_body: KGF Director Prashanth Neel, while talking about the film's success, said that the team never thought that they would be where they are today with the film. "The only person who had this vision was Yash. We started this as a small Kannada project and today the film is really big and the expectations are very high," Prashanth added.

89.title: 4 booked for vandalising 3D cinema screen during 'KGF 2' screening in Guj
89.article_body: Police have booked four unidentified persons for allegedly vandalising a 17-feet 3D screen at a cinema theatre in Gujarat's Vadodara and assaulting the ticket checkers while watching the newly-released film 'KGF: Chapter 2' in a late-night show. The cost of the screen was ₹3.5 lakh. The accused had allegedly occupied seats different from their designated ones in the cinema hall.

90.title: 5 injured in shooting outside mosque in Canada's Toronto
90.article_body: Five people were reportedly injured after unidentified attackers opened fire on a group of people at a parking lot of a mosque in Canada's Toronto on Saturday. The victims were leaving the mosque after Ramzan prayers around midnight. The suspects fled in a blue car after the shooting, said police, adding, it could have been a "random act of violence".

91.title: Teacher uses Heimlich manoeuvre to save choking student in US, video surfaces
91.article_body: A video has surfaced online that captured the moment when a teacher saved a nine-year-old choking student who had accidentally swallowed a bottle cap in the US. It showed the boy attempting to open the water bottle when he started to choke. The teacher performed the Heimlich manoeuvre, an emergency first aid measure for upper airwave obstructions, on the student.

92.title: Rajkummar Rao wraps up shooting for 'HIT - The First Case'
92.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has wrapped up the shoot of his upcoming suspense thriller 'HIT - The First Case'. Taking to his Instagram Story, he shared a picture of a clapboard which read, "It's a wrap". "Can't wait for you guys to watch this," Rajkummar wrote alongside the picture. The Sailesh Kolanu directorial also stars Sanya Malhotra.

93.title: De Villiers will be proud watching Karthik finishing games for RCB: Kohli
93.article_body: While interviewing RCB teammate Dinesh Karthik after their win against DC, Virat Kohli told the wicketkeeper-batter that AB de Villiers will be very proud watching him finishing the games for them. "It was an honour to watch you bat again," added Kohli. Karthik has remained unbeaten in five of their six games and has scored a total of 197 runs.

94.title: Electrician dies after getting electrocuted at Haryana Power Minister's house
94.article_body: A 33-year-old contractual electrician died after being electrocuted while rectifying a fault in a cooler in Haryana Power Minister Ranjit Singh Chautala's house. Police have ruled out any foul play behind the death. A cook in the house saw the electrician become motionless after his head fell in the water-filled cooler, following which she raised an alarm, police said.

95.title: Pressure cooker explodes in Ambala jail, 3 inmates injured
95.article_body: Three inmates sustained burn injuries when a pressure cooker exploded in the Ambala central jail, police said on Saturday. The incident took place when the inmates were cooking a meal in the prison kitchen on Friday night, the cooker burst and splashes of boiling food fell on the inmates, police added. One inmate was sent back after first aid.

96.title: Apprenticeship fair for ITI pass-outs in Noida on Apr 21: Officials
96.article_body: An apprenticeship fair is being organised for ITI pass-outs in Noida on April 21, officials said on Saturday. Forty major companies, including Samsung and Yamaha, are scheduled to participate in the fair that will be held at the ITI in Sector 31, they added. "Interested candidates can participate in the...fair between 10 am and 3 pm," a senior official said.

97.title: We’re not only eliminating rioters but will also end such mentality: MP Minister
97.article_body: The state government has eliminated the rioters from Khargone, MP Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said. "Shivraj Singh Chouhan-led government is ensuring that such incidents do not occur again. We are not only eliminating rioters but will also end such mentality," Sarang added. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said the state government will rebuild houses damaged by rioters in Khargone.

98.title: Salman ropes in 'Pushpa' music composer DSP for 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
98.article_body: Music composer Devi Sri Prasad, aka DSP, has reportedly been roped in for Salman Khan's film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. DSP, who composed music for Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise', has already started working on the upcoming film, reports stated. "Multiple composers will be working on...music of Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali, with DSP leading it from the front," reports said.

99.title: Policeman gets injured after being shot by criminal in Gurugram
99.article_body: A policeman was injured after a man shot at him in an attempt to try and free his accomplice on Saturday in Gurugram, officials said. Constable Gauri Shankar, who was shot in one of his legs, was rushed to a hospital. The incident took place after Shankar caught hold of one of the two alleged criminals following a chase.

100.title: 40th edition of govt of India's 'Hunar Haat' festival begins in Mumbai
100.article_body: The 40th edition of the Centre's 'Hunar Haat' festival was inaugurated by Union Minister Anurag Thakur in Mumbai on Sunday. The festival, which will conclude on April 27, is aimed at promoting ancestral crafts from remote areas of India. According to the officials, the event has provided employment opportunities to over 9 lakh artisans in a span of 6 years.

101.title: Radio Aksh, India's 1st-ever radio channel for visually impaired launched
101.article_body: 'Radio Aksh', India's first ever radio channel for the visually impaired has been launched in Nagpur. Reports said that educational resources that will have a variety of subjects have been made available through this platform. A team of volunteers helps in creating content for the platform that can be streamed to the visually impaired across India and world.

102.title: Several devotees take part in Karaga festival in B'luru, pics surface
102.article_body: Several devotees took part in the annual Karaga festival in Bengaluru's Thigalarpet on Saturday night. The festival takes place every year during the month of Chaitra at Dharmaraya Swamy Temple. "The festival is celebrated...to mark the return of Draupadi in the form of Adishakti, as she promised at the time of her death," BJP MP Tejasvi Surya said on Twitter.

103.title: Hope the drive was worth it: Karthik on viral 'Drove 1,000 km for RCB' poster
103.article_body: A picture of fans carrying 'Drove 1,000 km for you, RCB!' poster in the stands during RCB's IPL 2022 match against DC went viral. RCB batter-wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik, who scored an unbeaten 66 off 34 deliveries to help RCB win, reacted to the viral photo. "Hope the drive was worth it," he wrote.

104.title: Before-after pics show damage caused to Mariupol after Russian invasion
104.article_body: Ukraine's Mariupol City Council has shared before and after pictures of the Mariupol railway station to show the damage caused to the city after the Russian invasion. In his recent address, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the situation in Mariupol is "inhuman". The Russian troops invaded Mariupol, the strategic port city and a former Soviet state, on February 24.

105.title: Day RCB picked me, Bangar told, 'You'll be playing finisher's role': Karthik
105.article_body: Revealing his role when he was bought by RCB in IPL mega auction 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "The day I got picked, Sanjay [Bangar] bhai called...told me, 'DK you'll be playing the finisher's role'." Karthik hit 34-ball 66* to help RCB score 189/5 in 20 overs from 92/5 against DC in IPL. RCB won by 16 runs.

106.title: I visited doctor for gym injury in chest, they found the lump: Chhavi on breast cancer
106.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently opened up about her breast cancer diagnosis, took to Instagram to share how the cancer was detected. "I had gone to a doctor for a minor gym injury in the chest and that’s when they found the lump," she said. She added, "We investigated it further and further...till we did a biopsy...which came back positive."

107.title: I want to be a part of T20 World Cup 2022 desperately: Dinesh Karthik
107.article_body: Dinesh Karthik, who scored 66*(34) to help RCB defeat DC, said, "I know there's a World Cup around the corner. I want to be part of that World Cup desperately and help India cross the line." He added, "It's been a long time since India won a multi-nation tournament. I want to be that person who's helping India do that."

108.title: Gang using drones to smuggle heroin from Pakistan busted in Punjab
108.article_body: Three people have been arrested on Saturday as Punjab's Tarn Taran police busted a gang that was allegedly using drones to smuggle heroin from Pakistan. The accused claimed they sent drones across the border with sweets and other gifts and anti-national elements would tie heroin consignments during the return, a police official said. The police have also seized two drones.

109.title: Want to record song with Adele, perform live with Taylor Swift: Asees Kaur
109.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur, who sang the song 'Raataan Lambiyan' for 'Shershaah', said that she wants to record a song with English singer-songwriter Adele. "I really want to sing a song with her and release it," she added. Asees further said she also wants to perform with American singer Taylor Swift on stage. "It's a dream," said Asees.

110.title: Doesn't seem like CSK are going for replacement for Chahar: Jaffer
110.article_body: Wasim Jaffer, speaking about Deepak Chahar's injury, said, "It doesn't seem like CSK are going for a replacement." "Now that you've already invested three matches in Mukesh Choudhary so they want to try and stick with him," he added. Chahar was ruled out of IPL 2022 after suffering from a back injury while recovering from a quadriceps tear at NCA.

111.title: KL Rahul fined ₹12 lakh for slow over-rate against MI
111.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul has been penalised after his team maintained a slow over-rate during their IPL 2022 match against Mumbai Indians (MI) on Saturday. As it was LSG's first offence of the season relating to over-rate, Rahul was fined ₹12 lakh, the IPL said. LSG defeated MI by 18 runs.

112.title: Man sets world record for watching 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' 292 times
112.article_body: Ramiro Alanis, a resident of US' Florida, has set the Guinness World Record for the most cinema productions attended of the same film after watching 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' 292 times. Ramiro previously achieved this record in 2019 after watching 'Avengers: Endgame' 191 times but it was broken in 2021 by Arnaud Klein who watched 'Kaamelott: First Instalment' 204 times.

113.title: UP exemplary in dealing with violence: Minister on Delhi violence
113.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has been exemplary in dealing with cases of violence, UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta said on Sunday regarding the incident of violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. “Those indulging in violence have been dealt with sternly and will be dealt with sternly," Gupta said. I don't think anyone has the...daring to indulge in violence in UP," he added.

114.title: Mitchell Marsh was the villain: Kris Srikkanth on DC's defeat vs RCB
114.article_body: Former India batter Kris Srikkanth termed DC all-rounder Mitchell Marsh "villain" in his team's 16-run defeat against RCB. He added that Marsh created pressure for DC by scoring 14 runs off 24 deliveries. "Come on Mitch, you should have thought it out or just retired out," he added.

115.title: Twitter board may be concerned about other bidders: Musk on 'poison pill' move
115.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the Twitter board might have adopted the shareholder rights plan, or 'poison pill', out of concern about "other potential bidders" than just him. Musk was replying to a tweet saying the board has rejected Musk's offer to buy Twitter "20% above market value" by adopting the defensive strategy and also "threatened" to dilute shareholders' stake.

116.title: India have Pant, Rahul as keepers, Karthik can play T20Is as batter: Doull
116.article_body: Ex-NZ pacer Simon Doull has said RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik should be included in India's squad for the T20 WC in Australia as a backup batter. "India have got Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul as the backup keeper...maybe [Karthik] now goes into the team as a backup batter. He can bat at number six or seven...even number five," stated Doull.

117.title: SRH to bowl first against PBKS, Mayank Agarwal out due to injury
117.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal is not playing the match due to injury, with Shikhar Dhawan leading the side in his absence. Prabhsimran Singh has replaced Mayank Agarwal in PBKS' playing XI.

118.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor send cake for media at post-wedding party
118.article_body: Newlyweds Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor hosted a post-wedding party at their house on Saturday following their intimate wedding ceremony on April 14. The couple did not make an appearance, however, they sent cakes for the media persons waiting outside their Vastu residence. The party was attended by Shah Rukh Khan, Gauri Khan, Karan Johar and Tara Sutaria among others.

119.title: Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than law: Raj Thackeray
119.article_body: Amid loudspeaker row, MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that no one has opposed the offering of prayers. "Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than the law. After May 3, I'll see what to do," Raj added. "We don't want riots in Maharashtra...But if you (Muslims) do it on loudspeaker, then we'll also use loudspeakers for it," Raj stated.

120.title: BJP MLA booked for threatening alleged live-in partner in Navi Mumbai
120.article_body: Navi Mumbai Police has registered a case against BJP MLA from Airoli Ganesh Naik after a 47-year-old woman, who claimed to be in a relationship with him, alleged he threatened her. She said they were in a relationship for 27 years and had a son. She alleged that Naik threatened to kill her and himself by showing a revolver.

121.title: Punjab CM, ministers to visit Delhi govt schools, mohalla clinics
121.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and the members of his Cabinet will reportedly visit government schools and mohalla clinics in Delhi on Monday. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who is expected to accompany them, had said the ministers will be shown the "remarkable improvement" achieved by the AAP government. Notably, the Opposition has criticised AAP for running Punjab government through "remote control".

122.title: Pune's PMPML to run free Punyadasham bus services on April 19
122.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) will celebrate its 15th anniversary on April 19 (Tuesday) and it'll provide free Punyadasham bus services for all citizens on that day. Other bus fares will be ₹5 or ₹10, PMPML said. "PMPML encourages all citizens of Pune, Pimpri and Chinchwad to join our joy by using public transport on this day," it added.

123.title: Keep doing what you are, are on right track: Pankaj in letter to younger self
123.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, in letter to his 23-year-old self, said that he was doing the right thing and was on the right track. "You should not regret any decision, in the future too you won't regret it. Even if you commit any mistakes, they will teach you something," he said, adding, "You were always right...following one's dreams is very important."

124.title: PM lying, 40 lakh died in COVID pandemic: Rahul shares NYT report
124.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi was lying about the COVID-19 situation in the country. He shared a New York Times report which claimed that WHO has estimated over 40 lakh COVID-19 deaths in India. "Not five lakh, but 40 lakh Indians died in COVID-19 pandemic due to the government's negligence," tweeted Gandhi.

125.title: Poverty in India declined from 22.5% to 10.2% in 2019: World Bank
125.article_body: Extreme poverty in India declined from 22.5% in 2011 to 10.2% in 2019, a World Bank research paper said. Poverty reduction was sharper in rural areas, dropping 14.7 percentage points to 11.6%, while poverty in urban areas declined 7.9 percentage points to 6.3% between 2011 and 2019. Farmers with small landholding sizes have experienced higher income growth, the paper added.

126.title: 3 arrested for stealing buffaloes from shelter in Palghar
126.article_body: Three persons have been arrested for allegedly stealing buffaloes from a shelter in Palghar's Vasai. Police have also seized a small truck worth ₹2 lakh from the accused. The buffaloes were stolen from the shelter located near Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Pelhar. The accused were booked under provisions of Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act and Wildlife (Protection) Act.

127.title: I agree: Anand Mahindra on tweet calling 10-min grocery deliveries 'inhuman'
127.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Sunday tweeted, "I agree" while sharing a tweet by Pramesh CS, Director of Tata Memorial Hospital, that called 10-minute grocery deliveries "inhuman" for the delivery agents. Pramesh had tweeted, "I don't care how many trolls I get with this tweet...Customers can live with a two or even a six-hour delivery time."

128.title: UP STF arrests man for cheating mill owners on pretext of govt supply
128.article_body: UP Police STF arrested a man involved in cheating food processing firms, across the state, of several crores on the pretext of government supply, senior police officials said. The accused had cheated as many as two flour mill owners and four oil and ghee mill owners since the lockdown was imposed in the country in March 2020, the officials added.

129.title: 'China installed 3 mobile towers near Indian territory in Ladakh', says councillor
129.article_body: China has installed three mobile towers near Hot Springs in Ladakh, the Councillor of Chushul village in Ladakh has claimed while sharing pictures of the purported towers. Konchok Stanzin said that the towers were installed "very close to Indian territory", adding, "Isn't it a concern?...11 villages in my constituency have no 4G facilities."

130.title: Atmosphere spoiled for poll gains: Raut on Jahangirpuri violence
130.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday reacted to the violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, alleging that the country's atmosphere is "being deliberately spoiled to gain political advantage in elections". "Such incidents never happened before on Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti," he added. Nine people, including eight police officers, were injured in the incident.

131.title: I knew match was fixed: Imran Khan on his removal as Pakistan's PM
131.article_body: Former cricketer Imran Khan on Saturday reiterated his allegations of a foreign conspiracy behind his removal as Pakistan's Prime Minister. He said that he knew the "match was fixed" when a no-confidence motion was moved against him. "This conspiracy against our country...I want you to carefully listen if this was a conspiracy or an interference," Khan said at a rally.

132.title: Having my own iconic Bollywood dance songs is my end goal: Sharvari
132.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh in an interview has stated that she can't wait to have her own iconic Bollywood dance numbers one day, adding that it is her end goal. "Currently, I have been learning Kathak and freestyle hip hop almost every alternate day. I have converted a small room in my house into a dance studio," the actress said.

133.title: Indeed: Musk on tweet saying 'If the game is fair, Elon will buy Twitter'
133.article_body: Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, responded "Indeed" to a tweet that read, "If the game is fair, Elon will buy Twitter." The tweet further said, "If the game is rigged, there will be some reason why he won't be able to." It added, "We're about to find out how deep the corruption goes."

134.title: Okinawa recalls over 3,000 electric scooters after recent fires
134.article_body: Okinawa Autotech is recalling 3,215 units of its Praisepro electric scooters to check and fix any issue related to batteries. The recall comes amid recent incidents of electric two-wheelers catching fire across the country. Okinawa said that the batteries of its electric scooters will be checked for loose connectors or any damage and will be repaired free of charge.

135.title: Dinesh Karthik is getting better with age: RCB's Josh Hazlewood
135.article_body: RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood has praised their wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, stating that the 36-year-old is getting better with age. "He's doing it in every game...it's awesome to watch. His knock [against DC] was different," added Hazlewood. Karthik, who scored 66* off 34 balls against DC, is the eighth-highest scorer in IPL 2022 with 197 runs in six games.

136.title: Bullets were fired, people came with swords: Policeman on Delhi violence
136.article_body: A police officer, Medha Lal, who was injured in the violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday, said that people came to C-block side with swords. "Stone pelting started from the C-block side and bullets were fired from there too. I also caught a bullet and went to the hospital on PCR," he added.

137.title: Israeli police enter Jerusalem mosque 2 days after clashes
137.article_body: Israeli police have entered Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa Mosque compound two days after over 150 Palestinians were injured in clashes with the police there. The police, who cleared Palestinians from the area outside the mosque on Sunday, said that they had entered the mosque to facilitate routine visits of Jews to the site. The site is holy for both Muslims and Jews.

138.title: Union Home Minister keeping every minute's track: BJP MP on Jahangirpuri violence
138.article_body: BJP MP Hans Raj Hans visited the violence-hit Jahangirpuri area in Delhi in the wee hours of Sunday. "I couldn't sleep, wanted to go and check the situation myself. Union Home Minister (Amit Shah) is keeping every minute's track," Hans said. "Many agencies and forces are on the case...The matter will very soon be disclosed," he added.

139.title: COVID-19 patients can emit virus in faeces for up to 7 months: Stanford study
139.article_body: In the largest study tracking SARS-CoV-2 RNA in faeces, Stanford University scientists found that patients can shed viral genetic material in their faeces for up to seven months. Researchers analysed samples from 113 participants and found 13% of people were shedding viral RNA four months later, and nearly 4% had viral RNA in faeces seven months after their initial infection.

140.title: There's so much more to do ahead: Salim-Sulaiman on completing 30 yrs
140.article_body: Music composer duo Salim Merchant and Sulaiman Merchant, who worked on films like 'Chak De! India' and 'Band Baaja Baaraat', spoke about their three-decade long journey. "I feel like we've just begun," Salim said. "We started pretty early...and...never thought we'll get to where we are. But there's so much more to do ahead...and so much more to conquer," added Sulaiman.

141.title: Even Lord Ram will be restless over Khargone developments: Sanjay Raut
141.article_body: In his weekly column 'Rokhthok', Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that even Lord Ram would be restless over the developments in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. "If someone wants to stoke fire of fundamentalism...and disturb peace to win elections...they are sowing seeds of a second Partition," Raut stated, adding, "Stoking communal...fires in name of Lord Ram...is insult to idea of Ram."

142.title: Manipur media threatens to boycott govt, BJP, Cong for not paying ad dues
142.article_body: Manipur's media outlets have threatened to boycott the coverage related to the Manipur government, ruling Bharatiya Janata Party and opposition Congress over the non-clearance of their respective advertisement bills. In a joint meeting between newspaper publishers and media unions, it was decided that the three concerned groups will be boycotted if they fail to clear their bills by April 23.

143.title: 4 firefighters injured while dousing massive fire at Jharkhand forest
143.article_body: Four firefighters were critically injured while dousing a massive fire that broke out in a forest in Jharkhand's Hazaribag on Saturday, officials said. The fire damaged trees spread over six hectares of land, Divisional Forest Officer, RN Mishra, said. It's suspected that some miscreants among those who collect mahua flowers from the forest could have set the fire, officer added.

144.title: Chiranjeevi is a great guy, he's very humble: Sood on 'Acharya' co-star
144.article_body: Sonu Sood, in an interview, called Chiranjeevi a "great guy", and added that he's very humble and very grounded. Sood will be seen alongside Chiranjeevi in the upcoming Telugu film 'Acharya', which also stars Ram Charan, Kajal Aggarwal and Pooja Hegde. He further said 'Acharya' is a beautiful film. The film, directed by Koratala Siva, will release on April 29.

145.title: Not something I've given any thought to: Broad on becoming Eng's Test captain
145.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad has said he's not looking to become England's next Test captain. "It's not something I have given any thought to because firstly I am not currently in possession of a shirt within the England Test team," he stated. Root, who led England in 64 Tests, stepped down as the Test captain on Friday.

146.title: Russian artist jailed for replacing grocery store price tags with Ukraine war info
146.article_body: A Russian artist has been held behind bars for allegedly replacing price labels at a supermarket with information on Russian attacks on civilians in Ukraine's Mariupol. Alexandra Skochilenko faces up to 10 years in jail for this protest. Investigators have accused her of putting false information that was motivated by "political hatred for Russia".

147.title: Punjab govt transfers 17 IPS officers, 1 Punjab Police Service officer
147.article_body: The Punjab government on Friday issued transfer and posting orders of 17 IPS officers and a Punjab Police Service (PPS) officer. Among the IPS officers who have been transferred is the DIG of the newly formed Anti-Gangster Task Force, Gurpreet Singh Bhullar, who has been transferred and posted as the DIG of Rupnagar Range.

148.title: Muslim community welcomes Hanuman Jayanti rally with flower petals in MP
148.article_body: Members of the Muslim community were purportedly seen welcoming and cheering members of the Hindu community during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Saturday. As purportedly seen in a video footage, the procession was showered with flower petals from rooftops and balconies of homes of the Muslim community members amid heavy police security.

149.title: Singer Millind Gaba marries longtime girlfriend Pria Beniwal, pics surface
149.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend, social media influencer Pria Beniwal, who is the sister of YouTuber Harsh Beniwal. Actress Akshara Singh and anchor Shefali Bagga were among those who attended the wedding. Earlier, Gaba, who had featured in Bigg Boss OTT, shared pictures from his engagement ceremony on Instagram.

150.title: Sec 144 imposed in K'taka's Hubballi after 12 policemen injured in attack; 40 arrested
150.article_body: Around 40 people were arrested after a mob pelted stones at a police station in Hubballi in Karnataka's Dharwad on Saturday night, which left 12 police personnel injured. According to police, Section 144 of CrPC was imposed in Hubballi following the incident. The mob was reportedly angry over a provocative video posted on social media and demanded the accused's arrest.

151.title: Fan photoshops Rishi Kapoor in Alia-Ranbir's wedding photo, Neetu shares video
151.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to repost a viral video showing a fan photoshopping late actor Rishi Kapoor in Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor's wedding photo featuring Neetu, Bharat Sahni, Mahesh Bhatt, Soni Razdan, and Shaheen Bhatt. Riddhima Kapoor Sahni also reposted the video, writing, "Love this edit. Thank you for sharing." Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

152.title: We need to get better in all aspects: Ponting after DC's 3rd loss in 5 games
152.article_body: DC coach Ricky Ponting said they need to get better in all aspects of the game after suffering their third loss in five games in IPL 2022. "Mitchell Marsh was playing his first game...Rovman Powell hasn't fired in the middle order. So, we need to fix some things," Ponting stated. RCB restricted DC to 173/7 after posting 189/5 on Saturday.

153.title: Stone-pelting started from both sides: Police on Jahangirpuri violence
153.article_body: While talking about violence that happened in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, Inspector Rajeev Ranjan said stone pelting started from both sides. "Procession was underway peacefully...when it reached near C-Block mosque, a man with four-five others started arguing with those taking part in procession," he said. "On...Hanuman Jayanti, there was attempt to create communal tension," he added.

154.title: ₹10 lakh-pipes stolen from Maha water supply dept in Pune; 4 held
154.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Police have arrested four people for allegedly stealing 100 ductile iron pipes worth over ₹10 lakh from Maharashtra's water supply department premises in Pune's Khed. "[Two accused] have prior cases of theft...and two of them work as plumbers," a police officer said. An official said that there were no CCTV cameras or guards at the premises.

155.title: GST Council may do away with 5% slab; move items to 3% & 8% rates: Reports
155.article_body: The GST Council in its next meeting is likely to consider a proposal to do away with the 5% slab by moving goods to 3% and the 8% categories, as per sources. It is also said that discussions are on to raise the 5% slab to either 7 or 8 or 9%. Gold and gold jewellery attract a 3% tax.

156.title: Yash is angry young man India was missing, he fills void Big B left: Kangana
156.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to say that actor Yash is the "angry young man" that India was missing since decades. "He fills that void which Mr Amitabh Bachchan left since seventies....Wonderful," she wrote. In another story, she said, "South super stars are grounded and deeply rooted in their culture."

157.title: Labourer falls from 9th floor of under-construction hospital building in Delhi, dies
157.article_body: A 24-year-old labourer, who was working at an under-construction building of the Lal Bahadur Shastri Hospital in Delhi, died after he allegedly fell from its ninth floor, police said. DCP (East) Priyanka Kashyap said the victim succumbed to multiple injuries while undergoing treatment. Kashyap added that legal action is being initiated in the matter.

158.title: Will meet Amit Shah over Jahangirpuri incident: Delhi BJP chief
158.article_body: Delhi BJP President Adesh Gupta has said that he will be meeting Home Minister Amit Shah regarding the communal clashes in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday. "A delegation of Delhi BJP will go to the Jahangirpuri area and investigate the stone-pelting incident," Gupta said. He added, "This is not a coincidence but a huge conspiracy and the BJP condemns this."

159.title: South Korea reports 93,001 new COVID-19 cases, 203 deaths
159.article_body: South Korea saw 93,001 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, down from over 1.07 lakh infections recorded a day before. According to the health authorities, 203 more deaths were registered, taking the toll to 21,092. As many as 893 infected people were said to be serious, a decline of 20 from the previous day.

160.title: US arrested 2.1 lakh migrants at Mexico border in March
160.article_body: The US authorities arrested around 2.1 lakh migrants trying to enter the country from the Mexico border in March. It was reportedly the highest monthly arrests in over two decades and an increase of 24% from the same month last year. The Republicans attributed the rise to the rollback of former President Donald Trump's policies by the current administration.

161.title: RCB share video of dressing room celebrations after win vs DC
161.article_body: RCB have shared a video of the team celebrating in the dressing room after their 16-run victory over DC. In the video, Virat Kohli can be heard telling Faf du Plessis, "Keep me in the ring...skip," in a reference to his one-handed flying catch at covers. "Dinesh Karthik's knock and my catch are dedicated to AB de Villiers," Kohli said.

162.title: Taliban warns Pak of 'bad consequences' as Afghan civilians killed in airstrikes
162.article_body: Taliban-led Afghanistan accused Pakistan of airstrikes that killed dozens of Afghan civilians in Khost and Kunar provinces and warned of "bad consequences" if such attacks continue, according to spokesman Zabihullah Mujahed. "The Pakistani side should know that if a war starts it will not be in the interest of any side. It will cause instability in the region," Mujahed added.

163.title: Pics from Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's post-wedding party surface
163.article_body: Several pictures of newly married Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor from their post-wedding party have surfaced on social media. They hosted an intimate party that was attended by family and guests including Shah Rukh Khan, Karan Johar, Malaika Arora, Tara Sutaria and Arjun Kapoor, among others. As per a report, the guests were asked not to bring any gifts.

164.title: Uttar Pradesh ATS invokes UAPA against Gorakhnath Temple attack accused
164.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police's Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS) has invoked the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, who had attacked police officers outside Gorakhnath Temple in Gorakhpur. Abbasi was produced before a Gorakhpur court on Saturday, which sent him to judicial custody for 14 days. The ATS also interrogated Abbasi's father about his son and his activities.

165.title: Isha asked 'you think I can do Khallas', I said 'no one can give guarantee': RGV
165.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said that actress Isha Koppikar had asked him if he thought that she could do 'Khallas'. "I said, 'No one can give that guarantee...it is not a regular item song...It has scope for a lot of expressions...The way she says, Khallas, that is the soul of film, and you will get lot of exposure'," Varma added.

166.title: Govt questions WHO's method after report claims 4 mn COVID-19 deaths in India
166.article_body: The Centre has questioned WHO's methodology to calculate the COVID-19 deaths in the country and said the same mathematical model cannot be used for India and other countries with lesser population. This was in response to a New York Times article that stated that WHO estimated India’s death toll is at least four million, almost eight times the official numbers.

167.title: WhatsApp testing option to allow users to hide 'Last Seen' status from specific contacts
167.article_body: WhatsApp is testing the option which will allow users to limit specific individuals from seeing 'Last Seen' status. WhatsApp's iOS Beta version 22.9.0.70 has added the 'My Contacts Except…' option under the Last Seen section of the app's privacy settings, as per WABetaInfo. Before the update, users were only presented with three options: Everyone, My contact, and Nobody.

168.title: Cosmetics chain L'Occitane pulls out of Russia days after defending to stay open
168.article_body: French cosmetics chain L'Occitane has decided to shut its Russian operations, days after defending its decision to stay open. The company said that its decision followed the "enormous human suffering" in Ukraine. Last week, the brand said that it won’t close its stores in Russia as its staff might face retaliation as a result of the potential exit.

169.title: Ex-Reddit CEO says Musk 'is in for pain if he takes over Twitter'; he replies
169.article_body: Former Reddit CEO Yishan Wong in a long Twitter thread said that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "in for a world of pain" if he takes over Twitter. Wong suggested that Musk won't be able to uphold the free speech ideals of the "old internet". Meanwhile, Musk replied to this and said, "Twitter is way overdue for long-form tweets!"

170.title: Hardik Pandya most impressive among the new captains: Jaffer
170.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said GT captain Hardik Pandya has been the most impressive among the new captains this IPL season. "Hardik has impressed...the responsibility he has taken in batting, the bowling fitness he has shown...even when fielding he has affected a couple of run-outs," stated Jaffer. Currently, GT are at the top of the IPL points table.

171.title: Woman jumps off moving car as man tries to rape her; WB police arrest him
171.article_body: West Bengal Police have arrested a 31-year-old man for allegedly sexually assaulting an ASHA worker. According to the police, the investigation revealed that the man was trying to rape the woman in a moving car and the woman was able to jump off the vehicle. She was found unconscious on Makaibari Road and was taken to the hospital.

172.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from today till April 21
172.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will be facing power cuts between 9 am to 5 pm from tomorrow till April 20. However, several areas in Whitefield will be affected by power outages from today till April 21 between 10 am to 5 pm. The areas that'll be affected today include Borewell Road, Prithvi Layout, Upkar Layout and Whitefield Main Road, among others.

173.title: Mini Mathur shares pics from Cyrus Sahukar-Vaishali Malahara's wedding
173.article_body: Television host Mini Mathur took to Instagram to share pictures from Cyrus Sahukar's wedding with Vaishali Malahara. "It's...rare to have a wedding so full of love that everyone feels like father of...bride or mother of groom," Mini wrote, adding, "And given that all best stand up hosts were in attendance...laughter was hysterically abundant in every corner of their big day!"

174.title: Ship carrying 750 ton fuel sinks off Tunisia's coast; crew rescued
174.article_body: An oil tanker carrying over 750 ton of fuel sank off the coast of Tunisia on Saturday, authorities said.  While the country's government has activated a "national emergency plan for the prevention of marine pollution", the Environment Minister Leila Chikhaoui said that the situation was "under control". The ship's seven crew members were rescued and briefly hospitalised, authorities added.

175.title: 1st flight between Gujarat's Keshod & Mumbai flagged off by Jyotiraditya Scindia
175.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Saturday flagged off the first flight between Gujarat's Keshod in Junagadh district and Mumbai under the Centre's 'UDAN' programme. "We believe that with this flight connectivity, the availability of commutation facilities will help attract more passengers here (Junagadh) which would lead to an increase in business and tourism," Scindia said.
