352.title: Umran Malik's role is to run in and express himself: SRH head coach Moody
352.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad head coach Tom Moody has said that pacer Umran Malik's role in the IPL franchise is to "run in and express himself". "Umran has been embraced by the franchise...At the end of the day, when you are bowling 150 kmph in this format, you don't expect you are not going to go for runs," Moody said.

353.title: BTS' J-Hope shares pics with Lady Gaga, says 'My forever queen'
353.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS member J-Hope, who recently attended Lady Gaga's Las Vegas concert 'Lady Gaga Enigma + Jazz & Piano', took to Instagram to share a few pictures with the singer. "On the stage she was incredible, but off...stage, she was so professional," he wrote, adding, "Lady Gaga, my queen forever!!! I cheer you on as a fan!!!"

354.title: SRH completely dominated their chase of 176 against KKR: Pragyan Ojha
354.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said SRH completely dominated their chase of 176 in the win against KKR, adding that Rahul Tripathi, who was the highest run-getter in the match with 71(37), was "extraordinary". "You can see the difference between the...bowling attacks of both sides," added Ojha. SRH recorded their third consecutive win after beating KKR.

355.title: Man alleges doctors' role in illegal abortions, extorts ₹30 lakh in Pune
355.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 35-year-old man, Mangesh Manik Kanchan, for allegedly extorting ₹30 lakh from two doctors. Police said that Kanchan told doctors that he has a video clip of illegal abortions being performed. He also said that he would implicate them in a false case and demanded the money from them for not doing so.

356.title: Miley Cyrus spotted kissing 23-year-old Maxx Morando amid relationship rumours
356.article_body: Miley Cyrus was spotted kissing musician Maxx Morando on a sidewalk in West Hollywood amid reports that the duo are in a relationship. The rumours about Miley dating the 23-year-old started when they were spotted at Gucci's Love Parade runway show in November. Miley was earlier married to Liam Hemsworth from 2018 to 2020.

357.title: Good decision by Jersey team to release it with our film: Operation Romeo maker
357.article_body: Filmmaker Neeraj Pandey-backed 'Operation Romeo' will release in theatres on April 22, the same day as Shahid Kapoor-starrer 'Jersey'. Reacting to the same, Neeraj said, "I think it's a very good decision by the 'Jersey' team to release the film with 'Operation Romeo'." He added there's no clash between the two as both the films belong to very different genres.

358.title: Omicron-specific COVID-19 vaccine candidates cleared for clinical trial in China
358.article_body: Two candidates of Omicron-specific COVID-19 vaccine developed by units of China National Biotec Group (CNBG) have been approved for clinical trials in China. Both the candidates contain inactivated or killed Omicron virus. The trials will be conducted on adults who have already received two or three vaccine doses, CNBG confirmed in a statement.

359.title: BJP needs armies of illiterate goons, will never make good schools: AAP's Raghav
359.article_body: AAP's Raghav Chadha criticised BJP for felicitating the accused who were arrested for vandalising Arvind Kejriwal's residence and said that BJP will never work towards making good schools for people as "it needs armies of illiterate goons". "They won't even generate employment...if they do so then how'll they get lumpen elements for carrying out their violent agenda," he added.

360.title: Speeding auto-rickshaw mows down 11-yr-old boy in Mumbai
360.article_body: A speeding auto-rickshaw mowed down an 11-year-old boy in Mumbai's Kurla on Wednesday, killing the child. The deceased was crossing the road with his mother but was left behind when the auto-rickshaw hit him. He was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead before admission. The 40-year-old accused driver, Naushad Ahmed, has been arrested.

361.title: Fan's 'My girlfriend says me or IPL' poster at KKR-SRH match goes viral
361.article_body: A picture of a man carrying 'My girlfriend says me or IPL so I am here' poster during SunRisers Hyderabad-Kolkata Knight Riders IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Reacting to the picture, a fan jokingly commented, "My man has his priorities right." Another wrote, "An important decision made in your life." "True IPL fan," another social media user commented.

362.title: Barry Keoghan arrested in Ireland over intoxicated public order incident
362.article_body: Actor Barry Keoghan, known for portraying Druig in the 2021 film 'Eternals', was arrested in Ireland's Dublin after a complaint from a resident about a man outside their apartment window. Reports stated that Barry was intoxicated on a balcony but was not threatening. The 29-year-old actor was cautioned and later released without any charges and the incident is now resolved.

363.title: 'Seinfeld' actress Liz Sheridan passes away aged 93
363.article_body: Veteran actress Liz Sheridan, known for her role as Jerry Seinfeld's mother Helen in the sitcom 'Seinfeld', passed away aged 93 on Friday. Sheridan died of natural causes in her sleep in New York City, her representative Amanda Hendon confirmed. "Liz was always the sweetest, nicest TV mom a son could wish for," Jerry Seinfield wrote on Twitter.

364.title: 1,982 civilians killed, 2,600 injured in Ukraine war: UN
364.article_body: The UN has recorded the killing of 1,982 civilians since the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, but warned the "actual figures are much higher". Of the 1,982 civilians killed between February 24 and April 14, 162 were children, the Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) said. Over 2,650 civilians have also been injured in war.

365.title: Tejashwi Yadav thanks voters after RJD wins in Bihar by-polls
365.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday thanked voters after the party claimed victory in the Bihar by-polls. Tejashwi tweeted, "Hearty thanks to the public. People suffering from unemployment, inflation...have done a...job of defeating the anti-people policies." Notably, RJD's candidate Amar Kumar Paswan won the Bochahan Assembly seat in state by-polls by over 36,000 votes.

366.title: 2 held for attempting to snatch elderly woman's chain in Delhi
366.article_body: The Delhi Police arrested two accused who tried to snatch a chain from a 62-year-old woman who was out for a walk with her husband in Delhi's Paschim Vihar West area. "The woman lost balance and fell on the road and her husband, who tried to chase the accused, fell and suffered injuries," a senior police officer said.

367.title: Superintendent of Pune's Sassoon hospital removed
367.article_body: The Superintendent of Pune's Sassoon General Hospital has been removed days after the regional organ transplant authorisation committee at the institute was suspended over alleged malpractice during a kidney transplant procedure. Dr Ajay Taware, who was a member of the committee, has been replaced by Dr Vijay Jadhav. The malpractice took place at Ruby Hall Clinic in Pune.

368.title: Prashant Kishor asked to join Congress at meeting with top party leaders: Reports
368.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor was asked to join Congress during a meeting with top Congress leaders at party chief Sonia Gandhi's residence on Saturday, reports said. As per AICC General Secretary KC Venugopal, Kishor gave a detailed presentation on the 2024 Lok Sabha polls strategy to Sonia. The strategy will be examined by a group of Congress leaders, he added.

369.title: Stokes should lead the England Test side: Michael Vaughan
369.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said that all-rounder Ben Stokes should succeed Joe Root as England's Test captain. "I don't see anyone else who could take the position and be guaranteed of their place in the side," Vaughan said. "In Ben Stokes, you have clearly got someone who has got a smart cricket brain," he added.

370.title: 8 killed, over 20,000 affected due to heavy rainfall, storm in Assam
370.article_body: Eight people died and more than 20,000 people across 592 villages in Assam were affected after heavy rains lashed the state followed by a severe storm in the last 48 hours. According to the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA), the storm damaged 853 kutcha houses, 27 pucca houses fully and 5,809 kutcha houses, 655 pucca houses partially.

371.title: Mahanagar Gas Limited to organise cycle rally in Navi Mumbai on Sun
371.article_body: Mahanagar Gas Limited will be organising Saksham 2022 Cycle Rally and Walkathon in Navi Mumbai on Sunday with an aim to spread awareness about leading a healthy lifestyle and fuel conservation. The 5 km cycle rally and 3 km walkathon will start at 7 am at Sadhu Vaswani International School ground. It's an initiative of Petroleum Conservation Research Association (PCRA).

372.title: Sonia, Rahul & senior Cong leaders meet Prashant Kishor in Delhi
372.article_body: Congress interim chief Sonia Gandhi, her son and former party chief Rahul Gandhi and other senior party leaders like Ambika Soni, Digvijiya Singh, Mallikarjun Kharge and KC Venugopal met poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Saturday. The meeting at Sonia's Delhi residence lasted for nearly four hours. "Kishor has given detailed presentation on 2024 polls strategy," Venugopal said after the meeting.

373.title: Houses ruined in Khargone riot to be rebuilt with govt help: MP CM
373.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that the state government will rebuild the houses damaged by the rioters in Khargone. He further stated that the government will help for now but losses will later be recovered from the rioters. "Houses will be repaired with the government's help and the injured will be provided free treatment," the CM said.

374.title: I act the same way on TV soaps, films and OTT: Karan Wahi
374.article_body: Actor Karan Wahi in a recent interview opened up about the notion that television actors tend to overact when they work in other mediums. While talking about himself, the actor said that he acts the same way whether it's TV soaps, films or OTT. "Some people maybe overact, but...I think it's a perception that television is overacting," Karan added.

375.title: People have started pointing fingers at Kohli, it is a dangerous thing: Shoaib Akhtar
375.article_body: Talking about RCB batter Virat Kohli's form of late, Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "People have started pointing fingers at Kohli and it is a dangerous thing." He further said, "It's a performance-based franchise model and no one will be spared, not even Kohli. Even he can be dropped if he doesn't perform."

376.title: Set worth ₹7 cr erected in Hyd for Ravi Teja's Tiger Nageswara Rao: Report
376.article_body: A set worth ₹7 crore has reportedly been erected in Hyderabad for Ravi Teja's pan-India film 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'.  The upcoming project is a biopic of Tiger Nageswara Rao, a thief of Stuartpuram in the 1970s. According to report, the makers have constructed a massive set on a 5-acre land depicting Stuartpuram village. It also stars Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur.

377.title: Karan and I are a real couple, that's why people love us: Tejasswi
377.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash, speaking about her relationship with Karan Kundrra, said they are a real couple, not an ideal couple. "We have...broken up inside the (Bigg Boss) house. Then we've patched up and been the most real couple which is why people love us," she added. Tejasswi further said when two strong-headed people come together, fights are bound to happen.

378.title: Areas near major iPhone plant locked down in China's Zhengzhou
378.article_body: China's Zhengzhou has locked down some areas near Foxconn's main iPhone manufacturing base, amid COVID-19. Local authorities announced they are placing some areas in the Zhengzhou Airport Economy Zone under quarantine effective immediately. People in the area will not be permitted to leave. This comes after Apple suppliers, Pegatron and Quanta Computer, have halted production in some China plants.

379.title: Time is right for 'One Nation One Language': BJP's AP Abdullakutty
379.article_body: Days after Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark, BJP National Vice President AP Abdullakutty said that it is the right time to go for 'One Nation One Language'. "Today Hindi is not only an Indian language but also an international language. The Narendra Modi government is not against regional languages," he added. "Opposition parties misunderstood Amit Shah's intention," he further said.

380.title: My only selfie is with Messi, Ronaldo was in the room as well: Klopp
380.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he has only one selfie in his phone which is with ex-Barcelona forward Lionel Messi, adding that Manchester United attacker Cristiano Ronaldo was in the room as well. Ronaldo has scored 12 goals in 25 Premier League matches so far this season. "My father always [said]...whatever people say...Pele was the best," stated Klopp.

381.title: North Korea marks founder's birthday without military parade
381.article_body: North Korea on Friday celebrated the 110th anniversary of the late founder Kim Il-Sung with a parade and performances. This year, however, there was no military parade during the celebrations. North Korean leader Kim Jong-un attended his grandfather's birth anniversary celebrations but didn't give a speech. "The Day of the Sun" is North Korea's biggest annual public holiday.

382.title: Pic showing job aspirants studying for exams at Bihar ghat goes viral
382.article_body: A photo featuring hundreds of students sitting at a ghat near Patna University in Bihar is being widely shared on social media. The students studying at the ghat are said to be preparing for various exams like SSC, UPSC and JEE, among others. A user commented, "This is how a Bihari prepare for government jobs. Respect the dedication."

383.title: Chelsea need to rely on Liverpool, Man City having a 'meltdown': Cech
383.article_body: Ex-Chelsea footballer Petr Cech said Chelsea will need to rely on Liverpool and Manchester City having a "meltdown" to win the Premier League. "It is...out of our hands," added Cech. City are currently at the top of the points table, with Liverpool and Chelsea on the second and third position. City and Chelsea have 74 and 62 points, respectively.

384.title: Scientists discover cluster of cells in brainstem to treat blood loss
384.article_body: Scientists have discovered a cluster of cells in the brainstem that may help in controlling the body's response to blood loss that results in cardiovascular collapse. Known as adrenergic C1 neurons, these cells monitor blood pressure during blood loss. When they detect blood loss, their nerve activity increases constricting the blood vessels to maintain proper blood pressure.

385.title: Some plants left with only 1.5 days of coal: Maha Energy Minister
385.article_body: Maharashtra is grappling with an acute power crisis due to coal shortage, state Energy Minister Nitin Raut said. "While some plants are left with only 1.5 days of coal, some have coal that would suffice for three days," he added. "Koyna Dam is left with 17 TMCs of water; one TMC is needed every day to generate electricity," Raut stated.

386.title: TMC's Babul Supriyo wins Ballygunge Assembly by-polls
386.article_body: Former Union Minister and TMC leader Babul Supriyo won the Ballygunge by-polls on Saturday by defeating BJP's Keya Ghosh. As trends suggested his win, Supriyo appreciated West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee by saying, "Didi guided us for working on ground." Meanwhile, BJP's Agnimitra Paul, who lost the Asansol Lok Sabha seat to TMC's Shatrughan Sinha, said, "Babul Supriyo's victory...was predictable."

387.title: Umran is unique, but he concedes fours on many occasions: Williamson
387.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said pacer Umran Malik is "unique" considering his ability to bowl at a speed of 150 kmph, but added that he concedes fours on many occasions which is not "ideal". Malik took two wickets while conceding 27 runs in SRH's win against KKR by seven wickets. He has picked five wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

388.title: 38-year-old Noida man drowns in Yamuna river while taking a dip
388.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Noida drowned in the Yamuna river while taking a dip, police officials said. According to the officials, the man had gone with his family to pray at a temple on the river bank when the incident occurred. He was pulled out from the river and rushed to a hospital but he didn't survive, an official said.

389.title: Pak National Assembly Deputy Speaker resigns before no-trust motion
389.article_body: Qasim Khan Suri resigned as Deputy Speaker of Pakistan's National Assembly, less than an hour before voting on a no-trust motion against him was to take place for favouring the Imran Khan-led government. Sharing a copy of his resignation on Twitter, Suri said his move signified his association with the vision of his party, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), and democracy.

390.title: 183 dead dogs, lizards, birds found in US man's freezer; some were stuffed alive
390.article_body: A man in US' Arizona is facing animal cruelty charges after 183 dead dogs, lizards, rabbits, birds and other animals were found in a "large-sized chest freezer". "Several of the animals appeared to have been frozen alive due to their body positioning," police said. He was caught after a woman complained he hadn't returned snakes she'd lent him for breeding.

391.title: The younger and elder called Hema 'ji', she commanded that respect: Ranjeet
391.article_body: Actor Ranjeet took to Instagram to share a throwback picture of him with actress Hema Malini and said that everyone used to address her as 'ji'. "She always commanded that respect on sets. Chahe koi chota ho ya bada [No matter the person was younger or elder]," he wrote. Several users took to comments section to appreciate the picture.

392.title: 4 policemen booked for abetting suicide of school teacher in UP
392.article_body: Four policemen were booked for abetting a government primary school teacher's suicide in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj in March 2020. The victim was found hanging in a washroom of the Tirwa Police Station after he was brought for allegedly creating nuisance at his in-laws' house. The victim's family had alleged that death occurred due to severe beating by the policemen.

393.title: Harbhajan to donate Rajya Sabha salary for education of farmers' daughters
393.article_body: Cricketer-turned-politician Harbhajan Singh on Saturday pledged to donate his salary as a Rajya Sabha member toward the education and welfare of farmers' daughters. "I've joined to contribute to the betterment of our nation and will do everything I can," said Singh while announcing the decision on Twitter. Singh was nominated as Rajya Sabha member by the AAP government in Punjab.

394.title: Ranbir thinks there should be mystery around an actor: Neetu on wedding secrecy
394.article_body: Talking about keeping Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding a secret, actress Neetu Kapoor said that actor Ranbir Kapoor believes that there should be a mystery around an actor. "He likes certain things to be private and one of them is his personal life and we all should respect it," she added.

395.title: Chinese astronauts land after China's longest crewed space mission
395.article_body: Three Chinese astronauts returned to earth on Saturday after 183 days in space, completing China's longest crewed space mission to date. Zhai Zhigang, Ye Guangfu and Wang Yaping spent six months aboard the Tianhe core module of China's Tiangong space station. The crew was the second of four crewed missions to be launched during 2021-2022 to assemble space station.

396.title: Nagaland govt refuses to grant 'casual leave' to protesting doctors
396.article_body: The Nagaland government has refused to grant "casual leave" to doctors protesting for increasing the retirement age from 60 to 62. The decision was taken following reports of the Nagaland In-Service Doctors Association asking its members to take "mass casual leave" from April 18 to 20 in protest, the state's Chief Secretary J Alam said in a statement.

397.title: TMC's Shatrughan wins Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls by over 3 lakh votes
397.article_body: Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Prasad Sinha on Saturday won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls by over three lakh votes, helping his party win the constituency for the first time. Sinha defeated BJP's Agnimitra Paul. The seat had fallen vacant after singer-politician Babul Supriyo left BJP and joined TMC. "I was confident poetic justice will prevail," Supriyo said about Sinha's win.

398.title: UK PM Johnson banned from entering Russia after visit to Ukraine
398.article_body: Russia has barred entry to UK PM Boris Johnson, Foreign Secretary Liz Truss, Defence Secretary Ben Wallace, and 10 other British government politicians and members. The move was taken "in view of the unprecedented hostile action by the British Government, in particular the imposition of sanctions against senior Russian officials", Russia said. Earlier, Johnson visited Ukraine amid the war.

399.title: Duo pose as astrologers, cheat businessman of ₹46 lakh near B'luru
399.article_body: A 45-year-old businessman was allegedly cheated ₹46 lakh by two men who posed as astrologers near Bengaluru. The accused reportedly promised to solve the businessman's personal problems and demanded money from him on the pretext of various pujas and ceremonies. However, the duo went incommunicado after receiving the money, following which the victim approached the police and lodged a complaint.

400.title: Their unit in Himachal Pradesh is finished: Anurag Thakur to AAP
400.article_body: Reacting to AAP leaders' visits to Himachal Pradesh ahead of the state Assembly polls, BJP leader Anurag Thakur said, "They have no ground here, their unit is finished." Thakur's statement comes after AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari along with general secretary organisation Satish Thakur and Una chief Iqbal Singh joined BJP on April 9.

401.title: 63-yr-old cheated of ₹5.9 lakh on pretext of updating KYC in Pune
401.article_body: A senior citizen in Pune was cheated of ₹5.9 lakh after being asked to update the KYC information linked to his phone number by a fraudster. The 63-year-old claimed that he was told to download an application on the phone for the update. The fraudster withdrew ₹90,000 from the victim's account and also took out a loan of ₹5 lakh.
